interestingcomments.content: Leica announced the new Leica Photos App at photokina 2018. With the software it is possible to remotely control all Leica cameras with WiFi and to load pictures from the camera directly onto the smartphone.The app is available for iOS and Android. With Android, it will be finally possible to remotely control the Leica M10.The app will be released on October 25th. Users who want to have a look at the app can take part in the open beta test. Leica customers can register for a free beta-version of the Leica FOTOS app for iOS and Android devices at fotosapp.leica-camera.com. The app will continue to be available free of charge after completion of the beta-evaluation phase. --img--

interestingcomments.content: On 12/11/2018 at 2:03 PM, Map450 said: Afternoon all. As of 2 days ago I received my first Leica as a a gift. Couldn’t be happier with the camera, it’s functionality and photo capability for an entry level camera. I however am having a heck of a time trying to transfer pictures taken into the fotos app? Anyone else have this problem or could point me in the proper direction would be GREATLY appreciated. I have successfully connected the camera via WiFi just can’t get the photos into the app. I’m using an iPhone 8 If that makes a difference. Many thanks! Cheers mike- I had the same problem initially when I tried to connect the camera to the App. The wifi connection was OK but it would not transfer pictures. The problem was that I had not followed the connection instructions to the letter and that is why it was not working. You have to be precise with the order in which you turn on the camera and then the app for it to work properly. Reset everything and then re-nstall the connection following the precise order and it should work.. Peter
